p: Adaptation is “the process of adjustment to actual or expected climate and its effects”. In human systems, adaptation is intended to reduce or avoid risks [ 7]. Health adaptation to climate change can be categorised into three forms. Incidental adaptation is associated with actions taken within the health sector that aid climate change adaptation, but are not delivered for this express purpose. Linear adaptation activities are responses to specific climate threats through the implementation of adaptive practices that enable health systems to respond to identified risks. Finally, building resilience is about system-wide changes that improve the ability of a system and society to cope with climate change.
